articles.headline: A Warning as Markets Cool in Asia
articles.snippet: Inflation and corruption remain problems in India and some other Asian countries where stock markets have attracted Western investors.
articles.abstract: Inflation and corruption remain problems in India and some other Asian countries where stock markets have attracted Western investors.
articles.lead_paragraph: MUMBAI, India  Stock markets in India and a handful of other, smaller Asian countries, which surged last year as foreign investors bet on their fast growth, are starting to remind investors of the risks involved.

articles.headline: Tech Show Surprises, and the Stale
articles.snippet: The Consumer Electronics Show outshone last year’s gloom-and-doom edition by showcasing a few innovative products like the Atrix app phone from Motorola.
articles.abstract: The Consumer Electronics Show outshone last year’s gloom-and-doom edition by showcasing a few innovative products like the Atrix app phone from Motorola.
articles.lead_paragraph: The star of this year’s Consumer Electronics Show wasn’t even there.

articles.headline: China, in a Shift, Takes On Its Alzheimer’s Problem
articles.snippet: In a major shift in attitude that reflects the challenges of an aging population, China is starting to publicly confront dementia.
articles.abstract: In a major shift in attitude that reflects the challenges of an aging population, China is starting to publicly confront dementia.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI  Last year, an expensive, red-brick residential complex opened here, equipped with a hair salon, cinema, toy-cluttered game rooms and a karaoke suite offering the latest in pop music.

articles.headline: ‘Creepy,’ ‘Very Hostile’: A College Recorded Its Fears
articles.snippet: Documents released by Pima Community College offer details of officials’ concerns about Jared L. Loughner.
articles.abstract: Documents released by Pima Community College offer details of officials’ concerns about Jared L. Loughner.
articles.lead_paragraph: TUCSON  Officials at Pima Community College, where Jared L. Loughner was a student, believed that he might be mentally ill or under the influence of drugs after a series of bizarre classroom disruptions in which he unnerved instructors and fellow students, including one occasion when he insisted that the number 6 was actually the number 18, according to internal reports from the college.
articles.byline: By Marc Lacey and Serge F. Kovaleski

articles.headline: Auto Work Force Gets Dividend From Industry’s Rebound
articles.snippet: Ford and G.M. are expected to announce profit-sharing checks this month for their hourly workers, a tangible sign of the industry’s comeback.
articles.abstract: Ford and G.M. are expected to announce profit-sharing checks this month for their hourly workers, a tangible sign of the industry’s comeback.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT  The sweeping overhaul and surprising recovery of the American auto industry is about to pay off handsomely for the blue-collar workers at Ford and General Motors.
articles.byline: By Bill Vlasic and Nick Bunkley

articles.headline: As the Web Turns
articles.snippet: After learning that men often turned to women’s Web sites for advice on recipes and relationships, P.& G. started the Web site ManoftheHouse.com.
articles.abstract: After learning that men often turned to women’s Web sites for advice on recipes and relationships, P.& G. started the Web site ManoftheHouse.com.
articles.lead_paragraph: Hey, fellas, want to spice things up with your lady? Procter & Gamble, the consumer products giant, has some ideas.

articles.headline: Obama Calls for a New Era of Civility in U.S. Politics
articles.snippet: The president offered the nation’s condolences to the victims of the Tucson shooting rampage, urging Americans to usher in a new era of civility in memory of the fallen.
articles.abstract: The president offered the nation’s condolences to the victims of the Tucson shooting rampage, urging Americans to usher in a new era of civility in memory of the fallen.
articles.lead_paragraph: TUCSON  President Obama offered the nation’s condolences on Wednesday to the victims of the shootings here, calling on Americans to draw a lesson from the lives of the fallen and the actions of the heroes, and to usher in a new era of civility in their honor.
articles.byline: By Helene Cooper and Jeff Zeleny

articles.headline: Behind Tunisia Unrest, Rage Over Wealth of Ruling Family
articles.snippet: The riches of Tunisia’s president have fueled an uprising by Tunisians who blame corruption among the elite for the joblessness afflicting their country.
articles.abstract: The riches of Tunisia’s president have fueled an uprising by Tunisians who blame corruption among the elite for the joblessness afflicting their country.
articles.lead_paragraph: HAMMAMET, Tunisia  This ancient Mediterranean hamlet, advertised as the Tunisian St.-Tropez, has long been the favorite summer getaway of President Zine el-Abidine Ben Ali and his large extended family, many of whom have built vast beachfront mansions here with the wealth they have amassed during his years in power.
